events.title: Prototype Sprint Workshop
events.desc: Learn how to design and develop a mobile app by building a working prototype in 2-days! A step by step hands-on workshop that combines the best of the Design Thinking and Extreme Programming worlds that will not leave you the same.

events.title: Zombie Apocalypse Workshop: Building Serverless Microservices
events.desc:
Fight Zombies and Build Serverless Microservices!

Scenario:
A widespread viral infection transmitted through bites that cause human corpses to reanimate and try to eat other living humans has caused the fall of civilization as we know it. This epidemic (the ‚ÄúZombie Apocalypse‚Äù) has spread through every major metropolitan area around the world.

In order to fight this battle, we invite you with great urgency to register and attend the AWS Zombie Apocalypse workshop to restore order and rebuild what remains of our great civilization.

events.title: Nodeschool
events.desc: NodeSchool is an open source project run by volunteers with two goals: to create high quality programming curriculum and to host community web-tech learning events.

events.title: Talk.CSS
events.desc: It's our first anniversary! Join us for a celebration and learn something new about the front end world. There will be cake!

events.title: Hacking UX: Product thinking for techies
events.desc:
So you've got a techy business idea? How do you know exactly what is the product you should be building?

Designing product can seem daunting, but it doesn't have to be so. From understanding the basics of business models and user behaviours, this workshop with the amazing Melissa Ng will teach you the basics of how to design a stellar product your users will love.

events.title: CSSConf.Asia
events.desc: Bridging web design and implementation. The technical conference for experience designers and front-end engineers.

events.title: CSSConf.Asia After-Party
events.desc: The official CSSConf.Asia 2016 After-Party for conference attendees. Come and mingle, have a drink and make friends.

events.title: Tessel Workshop
events.desc: The founders of the Tessel project Kelsey Bresemann and Jon McKay are in town and are hosting this hands-on Tessel "Internet of Things" workshop. Kelsey and Jon will teach developers about the basics of hardware communication (GPIO, ADC, I2C, SPI, etc.), how to read datasheets, and how to start talking to sensors using JavaScript and Tessel 2. Curious? Find out more at https://tessel.io.

events.title: Web Audio Hack Day
events.desc:
Q. What is this WebAudio you speak of?

A. WebAudio is a (widely supported) W3C standard for generating, analysing and playing audio in the Browser. Checkout the spec here (http://webaudio.github.io/web-audio-api/)

Q. Where can I learn more about WebAudio

A. WebAudio School is a self-help style tutorial for learning WebAudio (http://mmckegg.github.io/web-audio-school/).

Q. What shall I bring to this HackDay?

A. Please bring you down laptop, headphones and anything else you want to use for your project, like MIDI controllers, Arduino, etc.

events.title: KopiJS
events.desc: A casual and relaxing coffee/brunch hangout among all developers, designers, makers and like-minded people.
